open-radar.description:
Area:
Home Screen 

Summary:
In iOS 10 with 3D Touch support device, there is a screen edge press gesture to activate app switcher window. It's gone in iOS 11.

Steps to Reproduce:
Hard press left edge of an 3D Touch device installed iOS 11 beta 1 or 2.

Expected Results:
Activate app switcher window.

Observed Results:
No reaction.

Version:
iOS 11 beta 1
iOS 11 beta 2(15A5304i)

Notes:
I'm not sure it's by design to remove it or just a bug. It's not mentioned on Release Notes as far as I know.

Configuration:
open-radar.title: 3D Touch Screen Edge Multitasking Gesture missing in iOS 11 beta

open-radar.description:

Steps to Reproduce:
- Long press a folder on Home Screen
- Lift finger to open folder
- Tap outside of the folder to dismiss

Expected Results:

Observed Results:

Version:
iOS 11 beta 3. iPad Pro 10.5

Notes:
See attached video for demonstration

Configuration:

---

Fixed in iOS 11 beta 4
open-radar.title: Long press home screen folder multiple times and it will disappear

open-radar.description:
Summary:
This is a duplicate of radar #40890518

Hi there!

The new AuthenticationService [1] in iOS 12 allows for supplying usernames and passwords to the system, which in turn can then be auto filled by the system into the login form that is currently displayed to the user. In addition, iOS 12 allows to auto fill one time passwords send to the user via SMS.

However, there are a lot of services which do not send one time passwords via SMS (like Google, Dropbox, Microsoft, Amazon, ...). Instead they use a third party app for generating these one time passwords for the user. These apps generate the code using two RFC standards:
* RFC 4226: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4226
* RFC 6238: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6238
Examples for such applications are Google Authenticator [2], OTP Auth [3] and Authy [4].

Now my suggestion: Why not allow these one time password applications ([2], [3], [4], ...) to supply the one time password to the system? Why is the one time password auto fill restricted to codes sent via SMS?

Best regards,
Roland

[1]: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/authenticationservices
[2]: https://itunes.apple.com/de/app/google-authenticator/id388497605?mt=8
[3]: https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/otp-auth/id659877384?mt=8
[4]: https://itunes.apple.com/de/app/authy/id494168017?mt=8


Steps to Reproduce:
 

Expected Results:
 

Actual Results:
 

Version:
12

Notes:
open-radar.title: Add support for auto filling one time passwords generated by a third party application

open-radar.description:
Area:
Something not on this list

Summary:
Apple is usually great at localization and encourage developer to take care of localization to support more users. However, with more TestFlight features in recent years, there is still no localization support in the whole testing experience. I suggest Apple to create localized TF invitation email and to localize the TF app.

Steps to Reproduce:
- Send TestFlight invitation to tester
- User receive email of instruction of downloading and redeeming the test app

Expected Results:
- User sees instruction accord with their device language setting or iCloud language preference
- Download TestFlight app with localized UI

Observed Results:
- All instruction display in English
- TestFlight app in English

Version:
Any iOS version

Notes:


Configuration:
open-radar.title: Localized TestFlight Testing User Experience

open-radar.description:
Area:
App Store

In this webpage (https://developer.apple.com/support/app-store/), Apple provides information of iOS version distributions across App Store users. 

We would like to have the same information for tvOS. It will help us to make decision of when to stop support for older system version.
open-radar.title: Please provide tvOS distribution information

open-radar.description:
Summary:
This is a duplicate of radar #8102097

At WWDC, there's always the problem of making sure your badge faces the right way if you want people to see your name. At SXSW, they had the same information printed on both sides of the badge. 

All previous WWDCs have had the same problem.

Steps to Reproduce:
Randomly flip the badge. 50% of the time it will show the front with your name and company, and 50% of the time it'll show the back side, which just has a bar code.

Expected Results:
Whichever side of the badge is visible, I expect to see useful information.

Actual Results: 
Half the time, the badge shows a barcode instead of name and company.

Version:

Notes:
Maybe you don't want people to read your name off your badge. You could always put your badge in a shirt pocket. Or use a fictitious name. Or your Twitter screen name.

Configuration:
open-radar.title: WWDC Badges should be double-sided

open-radar.description:
Apple ID of the User: 

Apple ID of the App:

In WWDC 2017, Apple announced auto-renewable subscription will provide server-to-server notification to developers' server to inform user's subscription status updates.

To setup is described in https://help.apple.com/itunes-connect/developer/#/dev0067a330b.

However there is only ONE subscription URL for each app. If developer's server-side team needs to deploy a new version to development/test environment, it will just affect production environment since it's the same URL.

In my company, we use [production] as Production domain, and [uat] as UAT domain. If we point iTunes Connect to [production], then we can't test IAP on UAT. If we point iTunes Connect to [uat], it will just affect current App Store users.

Use only one URL for both Production and sandbox make developer's server-side team hard to develop and test new integrations, since the same URL need to support dev/test and production environment.

We would like to suggest Apple to provide a separated URL setting for auto-renewable subscription notification for sandbox, alongside with current production URL.
open-radar.title: Auto-renewable Subscription Server Notification should provide separated URL for sandbox

open-radar.description:
Area:
Photos

iOS Photos can search photos with places. But it does not support search photos for user's current location, which is very useful when revisiting a place.

Suggest to add search photos of current location with keywords like: "here", "this place" in Photos.
open-radar.title: Photos to add search photos of current location

open-radar.description:
Area:
Home Screen

Summary:
App icons have "shadow" upon beginning edit mode. See attached video. 

Restart the device back to normal. 


Steps to Reproduce:
In home screen, begin editing by long press an icon. 

Expected Results:

Actual Results:

iOS 12 beta 2

Configuration:
iPhone X
open-radar.title: iOS 12 Icon "shadow" beginning edit mode

open-radar.description:
Issue category: UIKit

• Detailed description of the issue
Use Control Center slider to change screen brightness. In 90% chance, if you try to set it to the lowest value, the brightness did change notification does not been fired.

• Steps to reproduce
1. Adjust brightness from Control Center, to the lowest value (left most of the slider)
2. Sometimes the brightness did change notification does not fired.

• Expected result
UIScreenBrightnessDidChange notification should always fired after slider value change

• Actual result
Sometimes the brightness did change notification does not fired.

• Additional notes or comments
Also happen on iOS 7.
open-radar.title: UIScreenBrightnessDidChangeNotification does not fire when set value with Control Center slider to the lowest value

open-radar.description:
In WWDC 2017, Apple announced auto-renewable subscription will provide server-to-server notification to developers' server to inform user's subscription status updates.

To setup is described in https://help.apple.com/itunes-connect/developer/#/dev0067a330b.

However there is only one subscription URL for each app. There is no support for staging environment. This will make developer's server-side team hard to develop and test new integrations, since the same URL need to support dev/test and production environment.

We would like to suggest Apple to provide a SIT or sandbox URL setting for auto-renewable subscription notification, alongside with current production URL.

---
October 2 2017, 10:26 PM
Engineering has provided the following information regarding this issue:  Only one URL is used for notifications. When the app is in sandbox, the notification will have sandbox indicated in the notification.
open-radar.title: Auto-renewable Subscription Server Notification should have sandbox/test environment

open-radar.description:
Area:
Mail

Summary:
This is a feature suggestion. There should be a hint if there are login but disabled accounts when opening Mail. Now there are just new login options.

What I encountered:
I've added Google account to iOS but disabled mail, only enabled calendar and contacts.

When I open Mail, I can only see new login options. After I login with the same account, Mail tells me the account already login. I think this can be improved by provide a hint about disabled accounts.

Steps to Reproduce:
- For new device (no mail accounts setup before)
- Login to a mail account in Settings. Ex. Google.
- Disable the account for Mail
- Open Mail app

Expected Results:
Mail tells me I have account disabled, along with new login options

Observed Results:
Mail shows new login options

Version:
iOS 11. But this is behavior is exist for years.

Notes:


Configuration:
open-radar.title: Mail disabled account hint

open-radar.description:
Area:
Keyboard

Summary:
iPad keyboard tutorial keep showing on iOS 11 beta 3

Steps to Reproduce:
- On an iPad, new install iOS 11 beta 3
- In Settings, select multiple keyboards. (In my case, English and Traditional Chinese ZhuYin)
- Tap any text field to show keyboard

- Tap Globe key to switch keyboard (repeated)
- Tap .?123 key (repeated)

Expected Results:
- Shows Globe key tutorial once
- Shows new drag-down gesture tutorial once
- Keyboard switch to another one

Observed Results:
- Shows Globe key tutorial many times
- Shows new drag-down gesture tutorial many times

Version:
iOS 11 beta 3

Notes:
See video for demo

Configuration:
iPad Pro 10.5
open-radar.title: iPad software keyboard keep showing tutorial

open-radar.description:
Area:
Siri

Summary:
In iOS 11, there is a "Type to Siri" mode can be enabled from Accessibility setting. However when activate Siri, the keyboard cannot be changed.

Steps to Reproduce:
Enable Type to Siri in Accessibility Setting.
Activate Siri with long press Home Button.

Expected Results:
Keyboard will shown, and user can change keyboard.

Observed Results:
The shown keyboard is not enabled by user, and cannot change keyboard.

Version:
iOS 11 beta 1 and 2

Notes:
The keyboard shown in the attachment is not enabled by user (Not English, PinYin, or Emoji).

Configuration:
System language: Traditional Chinese
Region: Taiwan
Siri language: Taiwan / Traditional Chinese
Enabled keyboards: English, PinYin(Traditional Chinese), and Emoji
open-radar.title: Type to Siri Cannot Change Keyboard

open-radar.description:
Area:
UIKit

Summary:
UIBarButtonItem's color is controlled by UINavigationBar.tintColor. In iOS 11 if UIButton.appearance().tintColor is set, UINavigationBar.tintColor setter will be ignored.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. UIButton.appearance().tintColor = .orange

2a. UINavigationBar.appearance().tintColor = .red
OR
2b. navigationController?.navigationBar.tintColor = .green

Expected Results:
Case 2a. barButtonItems' color should be red.
Case 2b. barButtonItems' color should be green.

Actual Results:
Case 2a. barButtonItems' color is orange.
Case 2b. barButtonItems' color is orange.

Version/Build:
iOS 11.0(15A372) on iPhone 7 Plus and Simulators.

Configuration:
Xcode 9.0(9A235)

Discuss:
UIButton.appearance() is a subset of UIView.appearance(). Which means setting up app global tintColor with UIView.appearance().tintColor also "lock" navigationBar.tintColor.

Please see sample project.
open-radar.title: iOS 11 set UINavigationBar.tintColor ignored, if already set UIButton.appearance().tintColor

open-radar.description:

tvOS SDK

Summary:

On an Apple TV 4K connected to display with 2160p UHD - 60 Hz, UIScreen.main.nativeScale return 1.0 in code but it should be 2.0.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Get UIScreen.main.nativeScale with code
2. Read or print the value, which is 1.0

Expected Results:

Actual Results:
UIScreen.main.nativeScale should return 1.0 with code

Notes:
In debugging console (lldb) po UIScreen.main.nativeScale, returns 2.0.
See attachment for screenshot and sample project.

Version/Build:
Apple TV 4K(A1842)
Tested on tvOS 11.0, 11.1(15J5582a)
Tested with several 4K TV/display/monitor

Configuration:
open-radar.title: Apple TV 4K UIScreen.main.nativeScale return 1.0

open-radar.description:
Summary:
Xcode applications share the same preferences and build cache (in Derived Data folders). Most of time these files cannot be use across different Xcode versions. 

For example, when trying on New Build System between the legacy one, or Xcode 10 between Xcode 9, we often need to Clean Build Folder or the build will failed.

These issues can be solved by introduce path settings per Xcode version. Or I believe you can find a better solution so that developers don't need to Clean Build Folder after switching to a different Xcode.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a project on Xcode 9.3.1 and build it with New Build System (Shared Workspace Settings)
2. Close Xcode 9.3.1
3. Open the same project on Xcode 10 beta 1 and build it with New Build System (Shared Workspace Settings)

Expected Results:
Build succeed.
Each Xcode has different Derived Data paths and won't mess around each others' cache data.

Actual Results:
Build failed with many kinds of error because it loads caches generated by other Xcode.
Clean Build Folder and try again will build successfully.

Version:
Xcode 10

Notes:
Xcode can change Derived Data paths settings in Preferences or Per-User Workspace Settings, which is great. But these settings are shared between different Xcode versions. 

This is a common issues so I don't provide a sample project.
open-radar.title: Derived Data path settings per Xcode version

open-radar.description:
Summary:
This is a duplicate of radar #41117773

When writing domain names such as apple.com the Messages app will convert these into links. This doesn't work for .app domains such as workingcopy.app


Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open the messages app and start a new message
2. Enter the message text "Testing workingcopyapp.com and workingcopy.app domains" and send this to someone.

Expected Results:
Both workingcopyapp.com and workingcopy.app should be marked as links.

Actual Results:
Only workingcopyapp.com is marked as link while workingcopy.app is just regular text.

Version:
11.4 and 12.0 beta

Notes:
open-radar.title: Messages app doesn't recognize .app domains
